description: Students explore the form, history and theory of a particular genre or medium, including film, the novella, drama, poetry and short story, or the works of a single author or period. Coursework includes close reading, discussion, analysis and interpretation of visual and/or written texts.Taught in German. May be counted toward German major or German studies concentration. May be repeated if topics are different. Prerequisite: at least one 270-level course.
name: Top: German Literature

title: Topics in German Literature
